title: Preparing Your Garden for the Growing Season

tasks.task: Preparing a garden for the growing season
subtasks: Determine if soil needs a soil sample
Take a soil sample if necessary
Use MDSU Extension video to guide soil sampling
Remove old plant materials from soil surface
Check soil moisture by testing about two to three inches deep
Avoid working soil that's too wet, as it may lead to clumped soil
Consider adding compost or peat moss for nutrients and water holding
Till garden soil for a seedbed if needed
Plan garden layout with adequate space between rows for tilling and weed control
Plan appropriate spacing for plant growth
Plan crop rotations to prevent disease and soil depletion
Use a garden journal to document planning and growing season notes
Contact local NDSU Extension Agent for assistance with questions
